alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 9:58AM CST until February 11 at 7:50PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins, county roads and bridges begin to flood. Bailey Branch Road, State Highway 80 southwest of Danville, and State Highway 27 north of Danville may be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.9 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 19.7 Wed 8 AM 24.7 20.4 15.4 24.9 6AM 2/09 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
